heroIntro: Welcome to your family sanctuary in Cometa, Calpe – a 3-bedroom villa designed for families seeking space to grow and a safe neighborhood to call home. Priced at €435,000, this property offers exceptional value in the heart of Costa Blanca's most desirable towns. With 14 quality images showcasing the home's potential, this villa presents the perfect opportunity for families looking to relocate to Spain's sunny coast. Calpe has become increasingly popular with British and international families, offering an ideal blend of Mediterranean lifestyle and practical amenities. The villa's mountain views provide a serene backdrop to daily family life, while the location ensures convenient access to international schools, healthcare facilities, and vibrant beach communities. Whether you're seeking a permanent base for your family or a smart investment in Spain's property market, this Cometa villa represents genuine value in a region experiencing steady 7% annual growth.
areaSection: Cometa is a charming residential neighborhood within Calpe, a coastal town of approximately 30,000 residents nestled beneath the iconic Peñón d'Ifach rock formation. Located on the Costa Blanca in Alicante province, Calpe enjoys over 300 days of annual sunshine and a Mediterranean climate that's perfect for family living. The area features a fascinating blend of Spanish coastal culture and international community, with strong English and German populations creating a welcoming environment for relocating families. Cometa itself is known for its residential character, offering quieter streets than Calpe's beachfront areas while maintaining excellent proximity to shops, schools, and amenities. The stunning mountain backdrop provides natural beauty and excellent walking opportunities for active families.
lifestyleSection: Living in Calpe means embracing an authentic Mediterranean lifestyle with modern conveniences. Your daily routine might include morning coffee at a local café overlooking mountains, afternoon beach visits at the nearby Blue Flag Arenal-Bol beach, and evening paseos through pedestrian-friendly streets filled with family-owned restaurants and tapas bars. The town hosts vibrant weekly markets where families shop for fresh produce, fish, and local goods – a cherished Spanish tradition. Healthcare is excellent with Centro de Salud Calp and private clinics featuring English-speaking staff readily available. The expat community is well-established and welcoming, making integration smooth for families relocating from the UK or Northern Europe. Schools are plentiful including Lady Elizabeth School just 10 minutes away. Beaches are rarely crowded year-round, and the new tram system arriving soon will enhance connectivity to neighboring towns.
investmentSection: From an investment perspective, this €435,000 villa represents compelling value in Costa Blanca's appreciating market. Properties in Calpe have appreciated 7% year-on-year, outpacing broader European property trends. The typical weekly rental income of €1,000 suggests strong holiday rental potential if owner chooses. Comparable properties in nearby Jávea command 20% premium pricing, indicating Calpe's relative value advantage. With Spain's growing appeal as a digital nomad and retirement destination, combined with strengthening pound-to-euro conversion for British investors, Calpe properties continue attracting serious buyers. The planned tram extension further enhances accessibility and future growth prospects. Families can owner-occupy while generating income through short-term rentals during summer months, creating additional return on investment.
conclusion: This 3-bedroom villa in Cometa represents a genuine opportunity for families seeking quality Mediterranean living at accessible pricing. At €435,000, you're investing not just in a home but in a lifestyle supported by international schools, excellent healthcare, welcoming community, and proven property appreciation. The mountain views, safe residential neighborhood, and proximity to beaches create the ideal family environment. Whether relocating permanently or seeking a sound investment with rental potential, this property delivers on both fronts. Calpe's 7% annual appreciation trend and €1,000+ typical weekly rental income make financial sense alongside emotional appeal. Contact us via WhatsApp for a property viewing, detailed floor plans, or to discuss financing options. Your Spanish family adventure awaits in Calpe.

lifeAndAmenities.intro: Calpe provides families with comprehensive daily living conveniences, from healthcare and education to shopping and transport. The town seamlessly combines Spanish coastal living with international amenities, ensuring no compromise on quality of life.

healthcare.text: Healthcare in Calpe meets international standards with multiple access points serving families. Centro de Salud Calp provides public healthcare services with English-speaking medical professionals accustomed to treating international residents. Private clinics throughout town offer specialist services and shorter wait times. Hospital de Dénia, located 30 minutes away, provides comprehensive emergency and specialist care. Dental clinics, physiotherapy services, and pharmacies are plentiful. Most healthcare providers accept international insurance policies, and many practitioners speak fluent English. Preventive care and routine services are readily accessible, making healthcare management straightforward for expatriate families.

education.text: International education options make Calpe ideal for families requiring British or international curriculum. Many expat families successfully navigate local education options, with Spanish schools increasingly accommodating international students. Language schools for adults abound, making family language learning achievable.

shopping.text: Daily shopping in Calpe combines convenience with authentic Spanish market culture. Major supermarkets including Mercadona, Consum, and Lidl provide extensive product ranges and competitive pricing. The weekly Calpe market offers fresh produce, fish, meat, and household goods at traditional prices. Specialized shops for bakery, butcher, and greengrocers maintain Spanish shopping traditions while international products increasingly appear in supermarket selections. Shopping centers near Benidorm, 25 minutes away, offer high-street brands and varied retail. Online shopping delivery services work efficiently in Calpe, providing modern convenience alongside traditional shopping options.

transport.text: Getting around Calpe and the wider Costa Blanca is straightforward with multiple transport options. Alicante Airport, 60 kilometers away, provides major international connections with flights to UK and Northern Europe. The bus network connects Calpe to Benidorm, Valencia, and surrounding towns with regular daily services. The transformative tram system arriving soon will revolutionize regional connectivity. Driving is convenient with good road networks and affordable parking throughout town. Many families maintain cars for flexibility, though the compact town center is highly walkable. Bicycles are increasingly popular for exploring the town and coastal paths.
